fields.description:
Just markdown sometimes falls short of the things we'd like to do with our markdown files. For instance, we find it very useful to document the color palette for our projects in their respective README.md files, so we use stuff like this: {code} ### Millennials Theme | Font Color | Hex Code | Sample | | ---------- |:----------:|:--------:| | Dark Cyan | BCLOUD-0097A7 |
 
| | Cyan | BCLOUD-00BCD4 |
 
| | Blue | BCLOUD-2196f3 |
 
| | Dark Grey | BCLOUD-51626f |
 
| | Light Grey | BCLOUD-89a2b6 |
 
| {code} This just doesn't render well in Bitbucket. Github.com does support HTML and Atom's Markdown preview plugin does as well, so we're used to that and this is a bit frustrating.
fields.summary: Markdown should support HTML

fields.summary: Bitbucket pipelines are failing.

fields.description:
Once a user authenticates himself, Bitbucket honors what Git tell us, therefore, if the user has a wrong configuration in his git configuration file, Bitbucket accepts it as the user was able to authenticate himself.

Would it be possible to change this behavior in Bitbucket Cloud and to add the commit author based on the authenticated user and not the git configuration file?
fields.summary: Knowing who really pushed the commit

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no shortcut link feature on Bitbucket cloud repositories. However, there is one exists on [Bitbucket Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/add-shortcut-links-to-a-bitbucket-server-repository-897811720.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
The shortcut is a link to a site outside of Bitbucket cloud instance. The feature will allow users to quickly navigate to other links outside their instance. For e.g. the links could be used to reach the applications integrated with the repository.

h3. Why this is important
Similar functionality is available on Bitbucket server, it would be good to have the same on Bitbucket Cloud for users migrating to cloud.
fields.summary: Support shortcut links in Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
Hi,

Firstly, we already are aware that Bitbucket Cloud makes no attempt to verify local Git config, such as email and username, and simply checks the SSH key connecting has access/permission.

Consider the 2 following separate situations, which as far as I can tell, are unstoppable and unauditable currently in Bitbucket Cloud. Please correct me if I am wrong about this.

# I create a personal user account, set my local git config to match that user, and then push commits to our team repo.
# I simply add the email and name of a colleague in the same team, and push commits to our team repo.

In both these cases, Bitbucket Cloud will show the Author of the commit as the one in the git local config. There is clearly no attempt to check the authors identity has any access, or even has the used SSH key attached (it does not).

The team audit log does not show any commit history. The commits page in the repository only shows the spoofed information.

Please tell me how an Enterprise organisation with its own auditing requirements, is supposed to prevent or audit this. Surely I have missed something?
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud does not match or audit SSH key to user account matches

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to display an image in our wiki. Everything works fine in preview but when I save the page and try to view it in the browser I get a broken link for the image.

Please, can you help?

Thanks,

Raj
fields.summary: Image is not shown in wiki

fields.description: When a public key is added to the new repo, there is an email confirming, that an SSH key has been added to the repository. This email contains a grammar mistake: "ключём" instead of "ключом"
fields.summary: Typo in email sent in Russian

fields.description: Right now there isn't a way to make a fork from a specific tag using the api. Through the graphic interface it can be done using the "fork at" option, but in order to automate processes it could be interesting could do it using the API
fields.summary: Could use the "fork at" option through the API

fields.description:
Hello!

I'm getting this error while trying to install the [sharp|https://github.com/lovell/sharp] dependency on a pipeline. It started to happen this like 8 hours ago.

When I try to download that file https://github.com/lovell/sharp-libvips/releases/download/v8.7.4/libvips-8.7.4-linux-x64.tar.gz it works without problem.

{code}
> sharp@0.22.0 install /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/node_modules/sharp

          ^

    at Object.onceWrapper (events.js:277:13)

fields.summary: 403 Error while downloading dependency

fields.description:
I am currently unable to download files from a newly created Git LFS enabled repository using a deploy key.  Using my personal keypair I am able to clone the repository without any trouble, which leads me to believe that there is a bug related to using deploy keys.  The errors all look like the following:

{code}
batch response: Authorization error: https://bitbucket.org/...                                                                       
Check that you have proper access to the repository
{code}

I suspect this bug could be related to a workaround I used to transfer a Git LFS enabled repository following the instructions in the link below:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/current-limitations-for-git-lfs-with-bitbucket-828781638.html#CurrentlimitationsforGitLFSwithBitbucket-transfer_repo

Versions are as follows:\\
git version 2.7.4\\
git-lfs/2.7.1 (GitHub; linux amd64; go 1.11.5)

UPDATE:

I am seeing the same behavior even after creating a new repository and uploading files to git lfs.  When I try to clone the repository using the deploy key, I don't see any errors however all of my git lfs files are pulled down as file pointers and the files are not downloaded.  When I try to run {{git lfs pull}} I see the following error:

$ git lfs pull\\
batch response: Authorization error: https://bitbucket.org/%7B%7D/%7Bd7266f1f-1935-422b-921f-7ebcd42ded98%7D/info/lfs/objects/batch\\
Check that you have proper access to the repository\\
error: failed to fetch some objects from 'https://bitbucket.org/...
fields.summary: Deploy key not working with Git LFS

fields.description: When creating a build in Pipelines that has Artifacts, we provide temporary link that exists for 7 days in the build window. It would be nice to provide this link as a URL for the team, or even allow the team to to automatically push the Artifacts to the _Downloads_ page.
fields.summary: Create a direct Artifact link/button

fields.description:
I have this error when trying to check my SSH keys on Pipelines settings:

"Add-on Pipelines is not responding. Wait or cancel?"
fields.summary: Pipelines SSH Keys configuration not responding

fields.description:
Add option to require a checklist to be completed before a pull request is created.

Eg.

Changelog updated where necessary - [X]\\
Documentation updated where necessary - [  ]\\
...etc
fields.summary: Pull request checklist

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In Bitbucket Cloud, when selecting a Confluence link from the app switcher, it will redirect to Jira.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# On any page in Bitbucket Cloud, select the "Switch to..." icon on the left sidebar (3rd icon from the bottom).
# Select any Confluence link that you have access to.

h4. Expected Results
It will link to the Confluence page.

h4. Actual Results
It links to Jira instead.
fields.summary: The Confluence link in the "Switch to..." app switcher on Bitbucket Cloud redirects to Jira instead.

fields.description:
Today to compare the ramifications, we need 4 clicks away. Home> Branches> Select Branch> More Options> Compare. Comparison of branches is very routine.

It would be nice to have a keyboard shortcut or in the side-nav.
fields.summary: Shortcut to compare branches

fields.description:
There seems to have been a regression of this issue:\\
BCLOUD-15165_user_watches

Sometime yesterday our build stopped working, and investigating further it seems that {{fs.inotify.max_user_watches}}is down to 8192 again.

In our case it's a React Native app that fails to compile:\\
{{Error: ENOSPC: System limit for number of file watchers reached, watch '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/node_modules/react-native/ReactAndroid/src/main/res/devsupport/values-ru'}}
fields.summary: Pipelines can't build, fs.inotify.max_user_watches regression

fields.description:
The buildrun time container is failing on BB pipelines when running in the background.

By background, this is when you are not actively 'watching' the pipeline.

This has been reproduced by multiple people using Chrome web browser.
fields.summary: buildrun time container failing on BB pipelines when running in the background
PR rerun builds unlinking from PRs after the PR is merged

fields.description: Usually one would disable Redux Devtools in production. I can browse and manipulate the store on Bitbucket. It's not a big deal because it's mostly my own personal information but it does provide a potential attack vector if one changes the keys for example.
fields.summary: Redux devtools exposed in production

fields.description:
As far as I understand bitbucket pipeline records deployments and associates them to environments. This information then also is visible in JIRA.

I would like to request this feature exposed as an API endpoint to allow any other CI/CD system to attach the same information to any commit and Pull-Request.

...but maybe this is already available, but I just could not find it.
fields.summary: allow external systems to record deployments to different environments

fields.description:
Just add possibility to somehow set expiration date/time for any ssh key. At least for repositories (REPO -> Settings -> Access Keys)

It could be as easy as for openssh-server and its authorized_keys file format with "expiry-time" option (https://man.openbsd.org/sshd#expiry-time=_timespec_)
fields.summary: Support for auto expiration of ssh keys (at least for reading repo)

fields.description: I would like an filter to filter out pull requests which I have already approved.
fields.summary: Option to filter approved pull requests

fields.description:
Hello

I am having a pipeline which has to build my application several times for each environment and it seems that bitbucket is not updating the artifacts in consequent builds.

The result is that I end up trying to publish my testing artifact to staging environment.

Here is my pipeline outline:

--> (build front + build back) --> deploy testing --> (build front + build back) --> deploy staging

The second deploy fails since the artifact it receives is the one from testing.

Is there a way to tell bitbucket to discard previous artifacts ?\\
Is there a way to overwrite the previous artifacts ?

Thank you for your help

{code}
"{release/*,hotfix/*}":
     
      - parallel:
          - step:
              name: "[Back] Lint -> Build -> Test"
              script:
                - export STAGE=integration
                - build.sh
              artifacts:
                - "**/dist/**"
              caches:
                - lerna
          - step:
              name: "[Front] Lint -> Build -> Test"
              script:
                - export STAGE=integration
                - build-front.sh
              artifacts:
                - "**/dist/**"
              caches:
                - lerna

      - step:
          name: "[ALL] Deploy -> integration"
          trigger: manual
          deployment: test
          script:
            - export STAGE=integration
            - deploy.sh
          caches:
            - lerna

      - parallel:
          - step:
              name: "[Back] Build"
              script:
                - export STAGE=preproduction
                - build.sh
              artifacts:
                - "**/dist/**"
              caches:
                - lerna
          - step:
              name: "[Front] Build"
              script:
                - export STAGE=preproduction
                - build-front.sh
              artifacts:
                - "**/dist/**"
              caches:
                - lerna

      - step:
          name: "[ALL] Deploy -> preproduction"
          trigger: manual
          deployment: staging
          script:
            - export STAGE=preproduction
            - deploy.sh
{code}
fields.summary: Pipeline Artifact not Updated (Overwritten)

fields.description:
Facing pipeline deployment issue on apt-get update

Failed to Fetch -

http://httpredir.debian.org/debian/dists/jessie-updates/main/binary-amd64/Packages
fields.summary: Pipeline errors on apt-get update

fields.description:
Unable to run pipeline on bitbucket.

Failed to fetch http://deb.debian.org/debian/dists/jessie-updates/main/binary-amd64/Packages  404  Not Found
fields.summary: Pipeline

fields.description: W: Failed to fetch http://httpredir.debian.org/debian/dists/jessie-updates/main/binary-amd64/Packages 404 Not Found
fields.summary: W: Failed to fetch http://httpredir.debian.org/debian/dists/jessie-updates/main/binary-amd64/Packages 404 Not Found

fields.description:
BitBucket, I'm confused. This has worked for several months. Today it fail on a check in...

Here is the config:

h1. This is a sample build configuration for JavaScript.
h1. Check our guides at https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/14UWN for more examples.
h1. Only use spaces to indent your .yml configuration.
h1. -----
h1. You can specify a custom docker image from Docker Hub as your build environment.
image: node:8.9.4

pipelines:\\
default:\\
- step:\\
name: Angular Build\\
caches:\\
- node\\
script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.\\
- npm install\\
- mkdir wwwrootadmin\\
- npm install -g @angular/cli\\
- ng build --prod\\
- apt-get update

What the heck can I put here that tell this to not look for Jessie files and where can I go to read and REALLY understand what is happening here and what are my choices.

Thanks,\\
AM

fields.description:
Every time we create a hotfix to staging/master we name the branch something like hotfix/staging-fix/something and hotfix/master-fix/something

finding the target branch is impossible.\\
We type in "staging" - but the result we want (which is simply staging) appears too below in the list.\\
The branches that appear at the top of the list are actually the hotfixes..

This is a major bug in my opinion as it is preventing me to work and use bitbucket properly.

Plus it also seems to me like misinterpretation of the user story while developing.\\
This is not an enhancement.

I need a way to specify "staging" without anything.\\
For example: Prioritize by matching score to the search\\
Another example: Allow regex ($) and (^) to specify beginning or end\\
Another example: Allow quotes to specify exact match === instead of lookahead search.

Anything, but currently we need to prevent people from creating branches with master and staging in the name, and it is ridiculous.
fields.summary: creating PR is a pain since perfect match branch appears too below in the list due to less perfect matches

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User unable to see run pipeline from the branch if the branch name has "#" in it

###Steps to Reproduce

# Create branch name this_is_a_test#_test
# Push to remote repositories
# Navigate to branch tab
# Press the ... button on the branch name
# No option to run the pipeline from that branch

###Expected Results\\
User is able to run the pipeline from the branch\\
###Actual Results\\
User is unable to run the pipeline from the branch

###Workaround\\
Rename the branch locally by removing the #
fields.summary: Unable to run pipeline if the branch has "#" in the name

fields.description:
Currently, go lang default pipeline build is redirecting the user to use the old version which is deprecated. Please update to latest v1.12 and update the pipeline command:

Incorrect lines in pipeline script:

{code}
script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.
- PACKAGE_PATH="\${GOPATH}/src/bitbucket.org/\${BITBUCKET_REPO_OWNER}/\${BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG}"
- mkdir -pv "\${PACKAGE_PATH}"
- tar -cO --exclude-vcs --exclude=bitbucket-pipelines.yml . | tar -xv -C "\${PACKAGE_PATH}"
- cd "\${PACKAGE_PATH}"
{code}

Corrected script:

{code}
script: # Modify the commands below to build your repository.
- PACKAGE_PATH="${GOPATH}/src/bitbucket.org/${BITBUCKET_REPO_OWNER}/${BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG}"
- mkdir -pv "${PACKAGE_PATH}"
- tar -cO --exclude-vcs --exclude=bitbucket-pipelines.yml . | tar -xv -C "${PACKAGE_PATH}"
- cd "${PACKAGE_PATH}" 
{code}
fields.summary: Update go lang default to latest release v1.12

fields.description:

I always have the undefined link, but other developers on my team do not have this issue.

Also note that it is only the link in the middle of the page when no pull requests are present that is broken, the normal "Create a pull request" button on the pull request page works correctly.

Tested on 3 accounts, all using Chrome. Only 1 seems to have the issue.

Note that the code is correct because I get a different error message if I intentionally enter the wrong code.

This is on Chrome 73.0.3683.86.

Thankfully 2FA seems to work on Firefox, otherwise I would be locked out of my bitbucket account.
fields.summary: 2FA is broken on Chrome when signing into bitbucket.

fields.description:
Given a pipeline is configured for pull requests.

When the user opens a PR A from a given source branch A to a given target branch B.

The pipeline should run correctly for PR A.

When the user pushes a new commit into the source branch A, if the PR A is not yet merged or closed.

The pipeline should run again for PR A.

But when the user opens a new PR B from the source branch C to target branch A and PR B is merged.

The pipeline will not run for PR A, even if the head of source branch A has been updated.
fields.summary: Pull request pipeline does not run if another PR is merged into source branch

fields.description:
This issue has arisen as a result of the following original request:\\
BCLOUD-13676

As per the original suggestion in the above request, ops configuration should only ever be read from a single branch. This would work well with branch restrictions already available within Bitbucket Pipelines.

Since the original suggestion did not get implemented, the same issues relating to security still exist. One such example can be seen by the following use-case.

=== Use-case ===

{code}
#!python
pull-requests:
    '**':
      - step:
          script:
            - sh run-tests-and-auto-merge-if-coverage-sufficient.sh
            # Since the above needs to be performed on every branch, it follows that any API keys used is accessible on every branch.
          services:
            - docker

{code}

There's nothing to stop a user from modifying the sufficiency test within {{run-tests-and-auto-merge-if-coverage-sufficient.sh}} and push the changes to the branch that they are working on. As it currently stands, Bitbucket Pipelines will recognise and make use of the updated {{run-tests-and-auto-merge-if-coverage-sufficient.sh}}.

=== End of Use-case ===

Unlike the original suggestion, it's not sufficient to only read contents of the {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} file from a single branch. In most setups, this yml file will reference other files (in the use-case above, {{run-tests-and-auto-merge-if-coverage-sufficient.sh}} is one such file).

Therefore, it's important to first define what an ops configuration is. To me, it's any file that is utilised within your pipelines, including of course (but not limited to) {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}}.

While having a separate repo for your ops configuration is one solution, a more simpler one would be to simply have BitBucket Pipelines recognise a directory at the root of your code repo. Let's call this directory {{.pipelines}} (say).

{{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} could stay at its current (expected) location to maintain backwards compatibility. All your other scripts can then go under {{.pipelines}} and the single branch that is responsible for providing the _true_ copy can then be set.
fields.summary: Restrict Pipelines configuration and other files to be read from specific branches

fields.description:

fields.description:
Hi All,

I tried multiple times with different YML version and am not able to do this.

I have 3 branches :\\
Master\\
UAT\\
CICD

I want to achieve this:

When someone does a PR to UAT and its approved,

* Everything is copied to CICD
* UAT is rebased to master or reset to master

What i have tried:

image: php:5.6.31

clone:\\
depth: full

pipelines:\\
pull-requests:\\
uat:\\
- step:\\
name: Clone\\
script:\\
- echo "CICD Branch Creation"\\
- apt-get update && apt-get install -y unzip git\\
- git config --global user.email "XXX"  && git config --global user.name "XXX"\\
- git checkout -B cicd\\
- git push -f origin cicd

branches:\\
cicd:\\
- step:\\
name: Build and release\\
script:\\
- apt-get update && apt-get install -y unzip git\\
- git checkout master\\
- git checkout -B uat master\\
- git push -f origin uat

I would think that when a PR is made to UAT THE 1st block run and copied all to cicd.\\
When CICD sees a push, it runs ITS OWN Branch block and resets UAT ?? This does not work. When i do a PR and merge it to UAT nothing is ran. But the push to cicd is ok, it clears UAT -> sync to master.
fields.summary: Reseting Branch after PR

*Expected Result:*

*Actual Result*

Trying to edit the branch permission will end up with an error message 'Unexpected error has occured'

!https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/attachments/18377/site/master/1553098610.97/18377/Screen%20Shot%202019-03-20%20at%2013.14.24.png!

*Workaround*\\

fields.description:
I have 2 accounts. Account A has 2FA enabled and Account B doesn't.

If I was logged in to biitbucket.org with Account A and want to use JIRA in the cloud with Account B I am presented with the 2FA page requiring a code for Account A. I cannot get into JIRA in the cloud without using my phone to find and enter the code and then log out before being able to use Account B.

If the page for capturing the 2FA code had a "Use a different account" link or a logout link I will be able to log out and then login with the credentials for Account B.
fields.summary: 2FA pages needs a "Use a different account" link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Enabling Atlassian Editor (Beta) feature disables normal editor for Description section under Issues in Bitbucket account.

h3. Suggested Solution
Description section in Issue create/view screen should show the normal Editor as it used to appear before this feature release.

Before the feature release:

!3888655719-Screen%20Shot%202019-03-20%20at%207.07.51%20PM.png|thumbnail!

After the feature release:

!4227443553-Screen%20Shot%202019-03-20%20at%207.14.24%20PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Why this is important
It is impossible to paste images and modify text without this functionality

h3. Workaround
Disable Atlassian Editor(Beta) feature from Bitbucket Labs.

* Click your avatar in the Bitbucket sidebar (bottom-left)
* Select Bitbucket Labs.
* Disable the Atlassian Editor (BETA) feature.
fields.summary: Enabling Atlassian Editor (Beta) feature disables normal editor in Description section under Issues

fields.description: I would love to see a sum of the total amount of lines added/removed in a pull request.
fields.summary: PR: Display total amount of lines added/removed

fields.description:
Yesterday disappeared a toolbar in issue description. No buttons like {{Preview}} or {{Image}}.\\
Toolbar is present on {{Wiki}} and on Issue comments, but not on {{Create issue}} page or {{Edit issue}} page.

I have the issue in all repos under two separate accounts that I checked.
fields.summary: Toolbar in issue description disappeared

fields.description:
Your system also does not accept attachment images that inlcude (1) (i.e () parentheses inside the Issue Tracker description text field - very often I have files I am using which have the same file name so my PC auto increments (i.e photo.png, photo(1).png, photo(2).png) - your generated URL string does not allow for the parenthesis to be included in the filename meaning I have to rename the file every time!

Steps:

# Create an Issue
# Tap the Image icon in toolbar editor
# Select an image that includes parenthesis - i.e IMG_6676(1).PNG
# Fill out some test text inside the Issue and press "Create Issue"
# You will receive the following result after the issue is posted - see screen shot:

!304145012-parenthesis_issue.png|thumbnail!

I think the reason for this might be that parenthesis have not been utilised correctly in the initial string to handle when a file has parenthesis in the filename.  Here is the string you are currently using:

{code}
#!python

![IMG_7760(1).PNG](https://bitbucket.org/repo/******/images/1195010736-IMG_7760(1).PNG)
{code}

The parenthesis after 1) is ending the string causing .PNG) to be displayed after the issue is Created and hence breaking the URL to the correct image.

I think a quick fix would be to detect ( and ) in the file name and auto change ( to %28 and ) to %29 in the string name - this works and fixes the issues but you might have a cleaner solution.

For example the above string would change to:

{code}
#!python

![IMG_7760(1).PNG](https://bitbucket.org/repo/******/images/1195010736-IMG_7760%281%29.PNG)
{code}

After making this update to the string name as displayed above the image now displays correctly and the URL is not broken.

!3575432988-parenthesis_Fixed.png|thumbnail!

As mentioned above it should be simple to fix and would mean I (and I am sure many others!!) don't have to rename images every time we come across a parenthesis in the image name :)
fields.summary: Image Filenames with Parenthesis used inside Issue Tracker Text Editor Fail

fields.description:
We should adopt something similar to what Gitlab has for merge checks for pull requests:

"The merge request author and users who have authored\\
commits in the merge request do not count as eligible approvers, unless\\
self-approval is explicitly enabled on the project settings."
fields.summary: Change merge check behavior in branch permissions

fields.description:
The team I was hoping to migrate to server before 1.0 is gone is not ready so I need to find a solution to the group endpoint and update my tool to resume this effort for testing late April/May. I don't expect final move till July/Aug.

Prior to migrating to server, I want to mark each user and group in the repo to read access only.  So I need an api for that. I guess I can live without groups and click through each group per repo but how can they not allow PUT api for users??!!

This call works in the 1.0 API but there is no equivalent in version 2:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/privileges-endpoint-296093145.html

PUT  https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/privileges/{accountname}/{repo_slug}/{privilege_account} --data {read}

I have to process over 569 repos and growing so doing by hand is not going to work.

Is there any way the v1.0 privileges endpoint can be extended similar to what was done for groups or can something be implemented in the 2.0 API to accomplish similar functionality
fields.summary: Please consider leaving the privileges v1.0 endpoint available after April 2019

fields.description:
Is it already possible to define a component or a milestone in the bitbucket api v2?

I tried

{\\
component: "name_of_component"\\
}

and also:\\
{\\
component: {\\
name: "name_of_component"\\
}\\
}

But both give a format error. Also I am not able to find anything about this in the docs?\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/issues

Please let me know!
fields.summary: How can we define components in the issue api?

fields.description:

fields.description:

It would be nice if we could carry over the balance build minutes to the following month if there is a balance form the extra build minutes obtained.

fields.description:
I can only search commit message in one repository at a time in Commit view.\\
I wish I could search commit message of all repositories in Search view.
fields.summary: Ability to search commit message of all my repositories

fields.description:
The following endpoint always responds with 403 for a private OAuth consumer:

https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/<team-name>/members

I'm having the same issue with:\\
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/users/<user-name>/members

I've tried replacing team-name, user-name with uuid and account_id to no result (following this blog post: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/bitbucket-api-changes-gdpr).

I believe the consumer has enough permissions: Account (write), Team membership (write), Repositories (admin).

Many other API endpoints work as advertised with the same credentials.
fields.summary: teams/<team-name>/members 403 response code for a private OAuth consumer

fields.description:
I haven't found anything about this, so i am creating a new ticket.

I am using a joomla-page or wordpress or magento with codeception as testing-framwork.

I need to add a virtual-host, so i can access some URLs like: "example.local" or "magento.local" which points to 127.0.01 for example.

There are also other use-cases, why i need virtual-hosts for the webserver. I am not able to use "http://127.0.0.1/path_to_somewhere" for many reasons.
fields.summary: Apache Vhost Settings

fields.description:
If it isn't broken - why change it???  I have just tried to list an issue in one of my repos along with images / screen shots within the text (as I often do) only to find now I cannot drag and drop the image, I have to press "Select files" and FIND the image EVERY TIME and SELECT IT!  Why move backwards?  I am a paying customer and have been using you guys forever .. seriously I will look at another provider this update you've made is STUPID!

*Workaround:*  You can go to Avatar > Labs > Turn off "Atlassian Editor" Beta and the Text Edits will be back when creating issues. Apologies for this.

EDIT :

_The above *'Workaround'* line has been added to my original post by one of the BitBucket Staff - this has worked for me for now but just to make the steps crystal clear - Tap on your Profile Image (Lower Left of Screen) > Bitbucket Labs > Turn the Atlassian Editor beta off (and if you don't want to explain why then just copy and paste this URL);_

BCLOUD-18361

_I think maybe they were trying to improve the editor but it has a bug - hope they will keep us informed when the bug has been resolved as I would be happy to test out an improved version (so long as it doesn't disappear :) )_
fields.summary: Why has the built in text editor been removed when creating an issue??!!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to press show more in repositories sidebar in minimizing sidebar mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Minimize the sidebar
# Set chrome browser to zoom 110%
# Go to repositories page such as wiki
# There should be a 3 dot show more icon
# Pressing it doesn't do anything

h3. Expected Results
Clicking show more will show the hidden button tab

h3. Actual Results
Clicking show more does nothing

h3. Workaround
Revert the zoom to 100%
fields.summary: Show more button does nothing when clicked

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleting a user from repository does not delete them from Default Reviewer list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a user to a repository.
# Add them to the Default reviewer list.
# Delete the user from the repository.

h3. Expected Results
The user will still appear under Default Reviewer list.

h3. Actual Results
User deletion should delete a user from Default reviewer list.

h3. Workaround
Manual deletion of the deleted user from Default reviewer list.
fields.summary: Deleted user from repository still shown on Default reviewer list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a situation where a user is not able to add a new default reviewer because they do not have access to this repository, the error message would show the full name of the username/email that was attempted to be added.

This is considered to be an unauthorized disclosure of the account's personal details, in this case the full name of the account.

###Steps to Reproduce###

# Access the *Default reviewers* page in the repository settings.
# Input a user's username/email (that doesn't have access to the repository) into the field.

###Expected Results###\\
A generic error message that mentions that the user cannot be added because it doesn't have the access to the repository will be triggered.

###Actual Results###\\
The error message shows the account's full name (in this example the full name is John Doe):

"John Doe cannot be added as a default reviewer because they do not have access to this repository"

###Notes###\\
The full name of the account would still display even if that user's account is set to private.
fields.summary: The error message for not being able to add a default reviewer because they do not have access to this repository shows the user's Full name.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Open Google Chrome v72
# Navigate to a repository's source
# Click {{Clone}}
# Click the 'copy button'
# Paste into command prompt (or anywhere for that matter)

The pasted value is whatever was in the clipboard before clicking the copy button i.e. the button does nothing.

I tried with FireFox v65 and then button works as expected. Pretty sure this used to work in Chrome v71. Also, note the vertical scroll bar that doesn't need to be there.

!4084326392-clone.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Copy button in 'Clone this repository' popup not working in Google Chrome v72

fields.description:
As explained here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Set-branch-permission-to-user-groups-and-oauth-client/qaq-p/927263#U1033042

When you use push back in pipelines to tag some commits using Oauth authorization without any branch permission or a permissive one, it works fine. However, if you set branch permissions (matching the branch you want to push to) to a user group, Oauth access is no longer able to create tags or push even it has repository write and admin access.

How can both security mechanisms work together?
fields.summary: Unable to push with Oauth token if branch permissions are set
Need more fine grained mandatory PR approvals at files or directory level

fields.description:
Submitting on behalf of customer:

"On a pull request, I'd like the comments made down in the file changes show up where the rest of the comments are, with a reference link to jump down and view them in context.

This would be beneficial because they are easy to overlook."
fields.summary: Display pull request change comments alongside other comments.

fields.description: As of now any user that open the pull request the tab will be at the overview. It'd be useful if we can set the page to open based on the user level for example reviewer will go to the overview tab while the author goes to the activity tab.
fields.summary: Change the pull request page tab open based on user level

fields.description:
When an account has the Premium feature "Require two-step verification" enabled, Access Keys are unable to clone/pull LFS files, retuning _"To access this repository, enable two-step verification."_ even that it's not directly related to an account.

We do have some workarounds which might work for now:

* disable 2FA enforcement for that account to keep using that SSH access key
* create an [app password|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/app-passwords-828781300.html] with read-only scope and access the repo via HTTPS
* create a bot account with read-only access, with that SSH key configured for that account
fields.summary: "Require two-step verification"(Premium) feature breaks LFS clone through Access Keys

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to configure Branch permission using access keys unlike Bitbucket server as seen here [Add access keys to branch permissions in Bitbucket Server 4.14|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/bitbucket/add-access-keys-branch-permissions-bitbucket-server-4-14]

h3. Suggested Solution
Please allow configuring Branch permission to add rules using access keys along with individual users.

h3. Why this is important
This functionality would allow secured integrations with other application, for example, Bamboo.
fields.summary: Use access keys to add rules in Branch permissions

fields.description:
Copy of [BSERV-8635|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-8635]

It should be possible to edit/change the pull request author.

Use case: When a developer has signaled (e.g., via JIRA issue status) that a branch is ready for review but forgotten to create a pull request, the reviewer should be able to create a pull request and then change its author to the developer.

Other use cases from BSERV-8635:\\
Another reasonable use case is when the developer leaves the team/company. Typically projects get reassigned for maintenance/continuation purposes and it would be great if PR owners could be updated respectively.

There are times when a second developer has taken over the work that the first has done, and in some circumstances changed everything in it... at this point the second developer should be able to become the author of that pull request

Without the ability to edit, the reviewer has to pick from two or three bad options:

delay the review until the developer creates a pull request (may take a few days!)\\
create a pull request with reviewer as an author, which allows the review to proceed causes subsequent interaction and understanding\\
review the branch without creating a pull request, which means review comments are going to be attached to individual branch commits (among other problems).
fields.summary: Ability to change the author of a pull request

fields.description:
Unable to view the list of ssh keys that have access to my repository.

Although, when I attempt to add the ssh key again gives validation error that access key has already been added to another account
fields.summary: List of Access keys not displaying

fields.description:
This is an alternative solution related to the problem outlined in BCLOUD-13397. Force push to an open PR is almost always bad because the reviewers cannot see what was changed. A workaround is to disable force push completely, but it is often helpful when developing on a branch before a PR is opened.

If we could disable force push only on branches with open PRs, we could approximate the ideal situation which is that history rewriting is allowed as long as no one else is affected negatively by it.
fields.summary: Ability to prevent force push to a branch with open PR
Can no longer create deployment variables

fields.description: Images (png) are not displayed in the pull request / comments. Although in the edit mode the images are displayed.
fields.summary: Uploaded Images are not appearing in the Pull request.
